question: How to reconcile your premium tax credit
text:
How to reconcile your premium tax credit
          
        
If you had a Marketplace health plan in 2024 and also used advance premium tax credit (APTC) to lower your monthly premium payment, you'll have to "reconcile" when you file your federal taxes. This means you'll compare two figures:


The amount of premium tax credit you used in advance during the year to lower your monthly premium payment; and




The total amount of premium tax credits you actually qualified for based on your total income for the year.


Any difference between the two figures will affect your refund or amount of tax owed.
In addition, if you personally elected to use less premium tax credit during the plan year than what you were eligible for, then reconciliation is the process that connects you with those credits during tax season. If you reported your total income correctly to Virginia's Insurance Marketplace throughout the plan year, you are less likely to have any issues related to reconciling.
Virginia's Insurance Marketplace will mail or send all forms for reconciling by January 31st  you will need Form 1095-A when you fill out your 2024 taxes. If you don't receive this form, or something looks incorrect, please contact Virginia's Insurance Marketplace at 1-888-687-1501.
